ticket.title: Dynamic scopes and dynamic finders for belongs_to
ticket.original-body:
This patch consists of two changes:
1. the dynamic finders now accept belongs_to attributes.
2. attributes that can be used via a dynamic finder can also be directly accessed as scopes.
Example usages include:
@@@ruby comments = Comment.find_by_creator(current_user)
comments = Comment.creator(current_user).commentable(post).all
posts = Post.creator(current_user).published.my_named_scope.last
cases = Case.status("OPEN").priority("HIGH").my_named_scope.all @@@
The main advantage of this patch is that it allows easy formation of dynamic queries based on input, without needing to explicitly define named scoped in your models. For example:
@@@ruby scope = Comment.scoped({:include => [:creator, :commentable]}) scope = scope.commentable(post) if post scope = scope.university(params[:uni]) if params[:uni] scope = scope.creator(current_user) if params[:created_by_me] == "1" scope = scope.country(params[:country]) if params[:country] @comments = scope.all @@@

This patch consists of two changes:
1. the dynamic finders now accept belongs_to attributes.
2. attributes that can be used via a dynamic finder can also be directly accessed as scopes.
Example usages include:
@@@ruby comments = Comment.find_by_creator(current_user)
comments = Comment.creator(current_user).commentable(post).all
posts = Post.creator(current_user).published.my_named_scope.last
cases = Case.status("OPEN").priority("HIGH").my_named_scope.all @@@
The main advantage of this patch is that it allows easy formation of dynamic queries based on input, without needing to explicitly define named scoped in your models. For example:
@@@ruby scope = Comment.scoped({:include => [:creator, :commentable]}) scope = scope.commentable(post) if post scope = scope.university(params[:uni]) if params[:uni] scope = scope.creator(current_user) if params[:created_by_me] == "1" scope = scope.country(params[:country]) if params[:country] @comments = scope.all @@@
ticket.original-body-html:
This patch consists of two changes:

1. the dynamic finders now accept belongs_to attributes.

2. attributes that can be used via a dynamic finder can also be directly accessed as scopes.

Example usages include: 

  comments = Comment.find_by_creator(current_user)

  comments = Comment.creator(current_user).commentable(post).all

  posts = Post.creator(current_user).published.my_named_scope.last

  cases = Case.status("OPEN").priority("HIGH").my_named_scope.all

The main advantage of this patch is that it allows easy formation of dynamic queries based on input, without needing to explicitly define named scoped in your models. For example: 

  scope = Comment.scoped({:include => [:creator, :commentable]})
  scope = scope.commentable(post) if post
  scope = scope.university(params[:uni]) if params[:uni]
  scope = scope.creator(current_user) if params[:created_by_me] == "1"
  scope = scope.country(params[:country]) if params[:country]
  @comments = scope.all

This patch consists of two changes:
1. the dynamic finders now accept belongs_to attributes.
2. attributes that can be used via a dynamic finder can also be directly accessed as scopes.
Example usages include:
@@@ruby comments = Comment.find_by_creator(current_user)
comments = Comment.creator(current_user).commentable(post).all
posts = Post.creator(current_user).published.my_named_scope.last
cases = Case.status("OPEN").priority("HIGH").my_named_scope.all @@@
The main advantage of this patch is that it allows easy formation of dynamic queries based on input, without needing to explicitly define named scoped in your models. For example:
@@@ruby scope = Comment.scoped({:include => [:creator, :commentable]}) scope = scope.commentable(post) if post scope = scope.university(params[:uni]) if params[:uni] scope = scope.creator(current_user) if params[:created_by_me] == "1" scope = scope.country(params[:country]) if params[:country] @comments = scope.all @@@
version.body-html:
This patch consists of two changes:

1. the dynamic finders now accept belongs_to attributes.

2. attributes that can be used via a dynamic finder can also be directly accessed as scopes.

Example usages include: 

  comments = Comment.find_by_creator(current_user)

  comments = Comment.creator(current_user).commentable(post).all

  posts = Post.creator(current_user).published.my_named_scope.last

  cases = Case.status("OPEN").priority("HIGH").my_named_scope.all

The main advantage of this patch is that it allows easy formation of dynamic queries based on input, without needing to explicitly define named scoped in your models. For example: 

  scope = Comment.scoped({:include => [:creator, :commentable]})
  scope = scope.commentable(post) if post
  scope = scope.university(params[:uni]) if params[:uni]
  scope = scope.creator(current_user) if params[:created_by_me] == "1"
  scope = scope.country(params[:country]) if params[:country]
  @comments = scope.all
version.title: Dynamic scopes and dynamic finders for belongs_to
Dynamic scopes and dynamic finders for belongs_to

version.body:
I think it's preferable to go through the has_many association whenever possible. So you could do this in the first example.
@@@ ruby comments = current_user.comments @@@
But for cases where you need to search on multiple belongs_to associations then I could see this being really useful.
version.body-html:
I think it's preferable to go through the has_many association whenever possible. So you could do this in the first example. 

comments = current_user.comments

But for cases where you need to search on multiple belongs_to associations then I could see this being really useful.
version.title: Dynamic scopes and dynamic finders for belongs_to

version.body:
This seems to be a bit at risk of name clashes, the following slight change might help and is perhaps more readable:
@@@ ruby Comment.creator_is(current_user) @@@
Then you can also have the negative form, e.g.:
@@@ ruby my_post.comments.creator_is_not(some_user) @@@
I also have an implementation of these and many more which I'm intending to release as a plugin.
version.body-html:
This seems to be a bit at risk of name clashes, the following slight change might help and is perhaps more readable: 

Comment.creator_is(current_user)

Then you can also have the negative form, e.g.: 

my_post.comments.creator_is_not(some_user)

I also have an implementation of these and many more which I'm intending to release as a plugin.
version.title: Dynamic scopes and dynamic finders for belongs_to

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.

version.body: ugg nederland with a legendary brand, first glimpse of goedkope uggugg laarzenugg australia nederlandfor both ugg store rotterdam ugg schoenenugg kopenugg amsterdambeer-drinking cartoon appearance is not too cold, and it is a style boots, since many euramerican star street pats have sufficient terengganu Ugg snow handsome appearance and fashionable boots and the earth, Ugg sweep of popular wind continues to explode, ugg bestellenugg online kopenugg online bestellen Ugg there are many fans. About Australia Ugg sheep leather kinder uggugg goedkoopugg maten history dates back to 1978, called a Brian Smith Australian young surfing member once took a batch of sheep leather boots to America. In the past years, Australia craftsman people always habits in New Zealand seaside sewing sheep leather boots, however, is the young man with the business mind bold attempt will this Australian traditional products to the United States ugg boots sale. At that time, he only a few several pairs ugg nlugg in nederlandnep uggechte ugg leather boots, with full of passion and self-confidence, began in New York street hawkers.
